{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"plot3(x,y,z)", "p":"uses", "o":"3D line plot of x, y, z data.", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Use plot 3 of x, y, z to make a 3D line plot."},
    {"s":"mesh(x_ax,y_ax,z_mat)", "p":"represents", "o":"surface plot.", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"For surfaces, use the mesh command — it draws a grid over the surface defined by z values."},
    {"s":"contour(z_mat)", "p":"represents", "o":"contour plot of z.", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"If you want a contour plot — use contour z matrix."},
    {"s":"axis([xmin xmax ymin ymax])", "p":"uses", "o":"change axes", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"You can also control the axis limits with axis."},
    {"s":"title('My title')", "p":"uses", "o":"add

evidence: You can also control the axis limits with axis.
